str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
From Thessalos and nike; Thessalonice, a place in Asia Minor.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To declare openly, proclaim, preach, laud, celebrate. From kata and the base of aggelos; to proclaim, promulgate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Berea, a town of the province Macedonia. Perhaps a provincial from a derivative of peran; Beroea, a place in Macedonia.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To come, go.
And there, and yonder, there also. From kai and ekei; likewise in that place.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From salos; to waver, i.e. Agitate, rock, topple or destroy; figuratively, to disturb, incite.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To disturb, agitate, stir up, trouble. Of uncertain affinity; to stir or agitate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.
